0a39f78bcb297ab0ebe8a29c28bfed89 (12:34): bugmail: [Bug 7711] The "strong native semantics" are worded very similarly -- but not quite the same -- for input type=Number, input type=range, and progressbar. <http://lists.w3.org/Archives/Public/public-html-bugzilla/2009Sep/0971.html> ** [Bug 7710] "Any byte or sequences of bytes [...] that is misinterpreted [...]" - s/sequences/sequence/ <http://lists.w3.org/Archives/Public/public-html-bugzilla/2009Sep/0970.html> ** [Bug 7709] Prevent PU

338c23e8eafc19ec9236404deac0bef4 (12:38): "This library implements the content sniffing algorithm described in http://tools.ietf.org/html/draft-abarth-mime-sniff-01, which will eventually become a normative reference in HTML5."
0a39f78bcb297ab0ebe8a29c28bfed89 (12:38): Title: draft-abarth-mime-sniff-01 - Content-Type Processing Model (at tools.ietf.org)
338c23e8eafc19ec9236404deac0bef4 (12:39): It would really be good if people would be more careful in talking about the actual requirement in HTML5.
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (12:39): sounds like wishful thinking to me
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (12:40): it'd be really good if all specs defined error handling and were written to be implementable, too, but we don't all get what we want :-)
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (12:40): wonders if the I-D license these days allows copying I-D text into BSD source code
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (12:40): s/were written to be implementable/were written to be implementable even in the face of market forces requiring compatibility with legacy content/
338c23e8eafc19ec9236404deac0bef4 (12:44): Henri, ID text as in "tables"? "Code"?
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (12:44): 338c23e8eafc19ec9236404deac0bef4: as in spec text

338c23e8eafc19ec9236404deac0bef4 (12:44): As far as I can tell, authors can now (as of Sep 2009, see <http://trustee.ietf.org/docs/IETF-Trust-License-Policy.pdf>) mark parts of the spec to be "code components", and let them fall under the BSD license.
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (12:45): 338c23e8eafc19ec9236404deac0bef4: mpilgrim's implementation has lot of the spec text inline
338c23e8eafc19ec9236404deac0bef4 (12:45): I think copying excerpts was always ok, as long as the source was mentioned. But then, I'm not a layer.
338c23e8eafc19ec9236404deac0bef4 (12:45): i c
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (12:47): hm, i guess i can make the websocket rfc claim to be entirely consisting of code components

338c23e8eafc19ec9236404deac0bef4 (12:48): in this case the spec author should clarify which part of the spec falls under <http://trustee.ietf.org/docs/IETF-Trust-License-Policy.pdf>, Section 4; and the user of that text would then need to follow Section 4d.
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (12:49): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e, the source of web sockets is still under a liberal license right?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (12:49): yeah
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (12:49): then all is good
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (12:49): i don't think it's all that clear to people that the source is available
338c23e8eafc19ec9236404deac0bef4 (12:54): The "source" as in "the source of the spec"?
338c23e8eafc19ec9236404deac0bef4 (12:55): All what the readers of the ID see is:

338c23e8eafc19ec9236404deac0bef4 (12:55): "Copyright Notice     Copyright (c) 2009 IETF Trust and the persons identified as the    document authors.  All rights reserved.     This document is subject to BCP 78 and the IETF Trust's Legal    Provisions Relating to IETF Documents in effect on the date of    publication of this document (http://trustee.ietf.org/license-info).    Please review these documents carefully, as they describe...
0a39f78bcb297ab0ebe8a29c28bfed89 (12:55): Title: Trust Legal Provisions (TLP) (at trustee.ietf.org)
338c23e8eafc19ec9236404deac0bef4 (12:55): ...your rights    and restrictions with respect to this document."
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (12:57): yes
338c23e8eafc19ec9236404deac0bef4 (13:02): So if the IPR for the ID != the default IETF IPR, the ID shouldn't pretend it is (I can assist with the xml2rfc mechanics for that)
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (13:03): is there a way to make hte IPR for the RFC be MIT-licensed or better?
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (13:03): public domain would be neat
338c23e8eafc19ec9236404deac0bef4 (13:03): you can suppress the default boilerplate, and then put there whatever you want
338c23e8eafc19ec9236404deac0bef4 (13:04): of course this will need to be addressed somehow when you want to publish as RFC

0a39f78bcb297ab0ebe8a29c28bfed89 (13:04): changes: hixie: Include explicit text about how swapCache() doesn't change anything but the active cache. (whatwg r4048) <http://lists.w3.org/Archives/Public/public-html-diffs/2009Sep/0299.html> ** hixie: first first -> first five (whatwg r4047) <http://lists.w3.org/Archives/Public/public-html-diffs/2009Sep/0298.html> ** hixie: resolve a conflicting requirement (whatwg r4046) <http://lists.w3.org/Archives/Public/public-html-diffs/2009Sep/02

0a39f78bcb297ab0ebe8a29c28bfed89 (13:04): bugmail: "[Bug 7725] It should be made more clear that only the "disk representation" is changed, not the "memory representation". I.e. images are not suddenly reloaded etc." (2 messages in thread) <http://lists.w3.org/Archives/Public/public-html-bugzilla/2009Sep/0988.html> ** "[Bug 7723] duplicate word ("first first") should be "first five"" (2 messages in thread) <http://lists.w3.org/Archives/Public/public-html-bugzilla/2009Sep/0986.html> **
338c23e8eafc19ec9236404deac0bef4 (13:04): actually, suppressing may not work of things published as ID

69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (13:04): my question is, does "this will need to be addressed somehow" mean "the IETF will only let you publish as an RFC if you use their copyright" or does it mean "it's fine"
338c23e8eafc19ec9236404deac0bef4 (13:05): it means that if you want to publish as RFC, you will have to grant the IETF Trust certain rights.
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (13:05): or something in between, as with the w3c, who are apparently fine with it, but only if they are provided with the opportunity to debate it for a year
338c23e8eafc19ec9236404deac0bef4 (13:05): Actually, you already did by submitting the ID
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (13:05): it's not the IETF Trust i am worried about having rights, it's everyone else
338c23e8eafc19ec9236404deac0bef4 (13:05): I'm not sure what you need to do if you want to grant *additional* rights to other parties.
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (13:06): are the rights they ask for exclusive?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (13:06): ok
338c23e8eafc19ec9236404deac0bef4 (13:07): I really don't know.
139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884 (13:18): I don't think the IETF asks for exclusive copyright assignment
139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884 (13:19): the process RFC makes this clear

139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884 (13:22): "... the contributor, the organization he represents (if any) and the owners of any proprietary rights in the contribution, grant an unlimited perpetual, non-exclusive, royalty-free, world-wide right and license to the ISOC and the IETF under any copyrights in the contribution."
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (13:32): 338c23e8eafc19ec9236404deac0bef4: is your interest in the profile/version draft only profile or do you want version, too?
139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884 (13:33): it seems to me like if we have a version attribute at all, it should be a flat numeric version like for SVG
139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884 (13:33): not some weird text encoding of a set of profiles
139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884 (13:34): (not that I think it should have one, but it is lame to pre-empt the possibility)

338c23e8eafc19ec9236404deac0bef4 (13:45): (will be off-line for most of the afternoon)
